alert.note: Alert for Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 9:40PM MDT until August 30 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following counties, Richland and Roosevelt. * WHEN...Until 145 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 940 PM MDT, the public reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sidney, Culbertson, Fairview, Bainville, Froid, Nohly, Snowden, Fort Union, Wooley, Mccabe, Crane and Midway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
